panels.title: code_suggestions Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""

  or

    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"})))),

panels.content:
### Description

Ingress-NGINX Controller for Kubernetes to expose service to the internet. Fronted by Cloudflare WAF.



### Observability Tools

* [GKE Deployment: nginx-ingress-nginx-controller](https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/deployment/us-central1-c/ai-assist/nginx/nginx-ingress-nginx-controller/overview?project=unreview-poc-390200e5)
* [Stackdriver Logs: GKE Container Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Ecluster%5Fname%3D%22ai%2Dassist%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Econtainer%5Fname%3D%22controller%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Enamespace%5Fname%3D%22nginx%22%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Eproject%5Fid%3D%22unreview%2Dpoc%2D390200e5%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcontainer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=unreview-poc-390200e5)
* [Cloudflare: codesuggestions.gitlab.com](https://dash.cloudflare.com/852e9d53d0f8adbd9205389356f2303d/gitlab.com/analytics/traffic?host=codesuggestions.gitlab.com&time-window=30)

panels.title: triton_server SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="triton_server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="triton_server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="triton_server",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="triton_server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="triton_server",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="triton_server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="triton_server",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="triton_server",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="triton_server",monitor="global",type="code_suggestions"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description:
Filestore Disk Read IOPS Saturation.

See https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp#gcp-file for
more details
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, instance_name) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (stackdriver_filestore_instance_file_googleapis_com_nfs_server_read_ops_count{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"} / 60)
      /
      600
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.description:
GCP Quota utilization / limit ratio

Saturation on a quota may cause problems with creating infrastructure resources on GCP.

To fix, we can request a quota increase for the specific resource to the GCP support team.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, metric, quotaregion) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        gcp_quota_usage{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      /
        gcp_quota_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      ) > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: gcp_quota_limit_s4 component saturation: GCP Quota utilization per environment

panels.description:
GCP Quota utilization / limit ratio

Saturation on a quota may cause problems with creating infrastructure resources on GCP.

To fix, we can request a quota increase for the specific resource to the GCP support team.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, base_model) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        stackdriver_aiplatform_googleapis_com_location_aiplatform_googleapis_com_quota_online_prediction_requests_per_base_model_usage{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      / ignoring (method)
        stackdriver_aiplatform_googleapis_com_location_aiplatform_googleapis_com_quota_online_prediction_requests_per_base_model_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      ) > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: gcp_quota_limit_vertex_ai component saturation: GCP Quota utilization per environment

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
This resource measures GPU memory utilization per GPU.

If this resource is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.

For metrics, refer to https://github.com/triton-inference-server/server/blob/main/docs/user_guide/metrics.md#gpu-metrics.

For scaling, refer to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/tree/master/docs/code_suggestions#scalability.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
        nv_gpu_memory_used_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
        nv_gpu_memory_total_bytes{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nv_gpu_memory component saturation: GPU Memory Utilization

panels.description:
This resource measures GPU power consumption per GPU.

If this resource is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.

For metrics, refer to https://github.com/triton-inference-server/server/blob/main/docs/user_guide/metrics.md#gpu-metrics.

For scaling, refer to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/tree/master/docs/code_suggestions#scalability.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
        avg_over_time(nv_gpu_power_usage{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}[30m])
      )
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, gpu_uuid, pod, container) (
        avg_over_time(nv_gpu_power_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="code_suggestions"}[30m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nv_gpu_utilization component saturation: GPU Utilization

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
